column1: After the successful development of the Country Club Plaza in Kansas City
column3: J. C. Nichols turned toward development of his native Johnson County
column4: just a few miles from the Plaza. Prairie Village was platted in 1941 and was named after Prairie School
column5: which was established almost a century before. In 1949
column6: Prairie Village was named the best planned community in America by the National Association of Home Builders. It was officially recognized as a city in 1951.Remnants of the Santa Fe Trail are found in the city.Shawnee
column8: and Kansa Indians formerly owned the land now developed into the City of Prairie Village. In 1858
column9: Thomas Porter bought 160 acres of farmland in what is now Prairie Village; he raised all his children on that farmland and was involved in agricultural development and civic affairs.

column4: who owned 80 acres between Mission Road and Roe Avenue.

column1: Henry Coppock arrived in Johnson County in 1857
column2: before heading farther west to work in freighting and farming. He came back in the mid-1860s and bought land in 1865. Coppock built his family home on 900 acres in Prairie Village. Coppock's house stood for 30 years. Now on his land is Homestead County Club.

column1: The original Prairie School was built in 1882
column2: and a new building was constructed in 1912. This landmark was a community treasure until 1990.

column4: wanted to turn the farmland into suburban housing for soldiers returning home from the war. Nichols bought farmland from the Porters

column1: Prairie Village continued to expand as the Prairie Village Shopping Center opened in 1947 and the Corinth Square Shopping Center opened in 1955.

column1: Public education in Prairie Village is administered by the Shawnee Mission School District.  Middle school students attend Indian Hills Middle School
column2: whose mascot is the Knight.  High school students attend Shawnee Mission East High School.

column1: Private schools are: The Pembroke Hill School
The Johnson County Library serves residents of Prairie Village. The library's Corinth branch is in Prairie Village.
Notable individuals who were born in and/or have lived in Prairie Village include actress and dancer Sandahl Bergman
column2: former Governor of Kansas Robert Bennett
column3: and Hall of Fame professional baseball player George Brett.
